metadata.title: The Underperforming Team
metadata.subtitle: Lite
metadata.description: Your team is falling behind. Deadlines slip, conflicts rise, and morale sinks. Today you face the leadership challenge of diagnosing performance, balancing empathy with firmness, and deciding whether to coach, confront, or restructure.
metadata.hint: Tests your Empathy, Accountability, Coaching mindset, and Directness under pressure

dimensions.label: Empathy
dimensions.description: How you understand feelings, frustrations, and emotional signals

dimensions.label: Accountability
dimensions.description: How you take responsibility and drive performance outcomes

dimensions.label: Coaching mindset
dimensions.description: How you develop people rather than just direct them

dimensions.label: Directness
dimensions.description: How clearly and firmly you communicate expectations

scenes.label: Scene 1
scenes.title: The Slipping Deadline
scenes.body:
Your team lead approaches hesitantly: “We're… behind. Again.”

The room feels heavy. Eyes tired. Energy low. You sense deeper issues beneath the missed timeline.
scenes.tip: Your first move reveals your instinct under pressure.

options.label: A
options.desc: You push for immediate honesty and clarity.

options.label: D
options.desc: You avoid escalation, hoping tension passes.

scenes.label: Scene 2
scenes.title: The Fight
scenes.body: Voices rise. Two teammates erupt into argument in front of everyone. The room freezes. This conflict has been building for weeks.
scenes.tip: Your reaction reveals emotional intelligence and authority.

options.label: A
options.desc: You shut down escalation with authority.

options.label: B
options.main: Mediate: help them calm down and reset.

options.label: D
options.desc: You hope they resolve it themselves.

scenes.label: Scene 3
scenes.title: The Weak Link
scenes.body: One staff member consistently underperforms. Errors, delays, excuses. The team is losing confidence in them, and you feel the strain.
scenes.tip: Your choice reveals your courage and coaching instincts.

options.label: C
options.main: Reassign them to tasks they can handle.

scenes.label: Scene 4
scenes.title: Higher-Up Pressure
scenes.body:
Your manager messages coldly: “Why is your team performing poorly?”

The tone is sharp. Expectations are high.
scenes.tip: Your response shows your leadership maturity.

options.label: C
options.desc: You show clarity and strategic thinking.

scenes.label: Scene 5
scenes.title: The Quitter
scenes.body:
A team member quietly approaches you: “I’m thinking of leaving.”

This is a turning point — for them and for your leadership.
scenes.tip: Your move shows your values around people and performance.

scenes.label: Scene 6
scenes.title: Shadow You Appears
scenes.body:
A dark reflection of yourself flickers into view: “You lead with heart or spine?”

A question that shapes your leadership identity.
scenes.tip: Your answer reveals your core instinct.

options.label: B
options.desc: You lead with firmness and authority.

options.label: D
options.desc: You feel lost in leadership identity.

scenes.label: Scene 7
scenes.title: The Leadership Doors
scenes.body:
Three doors appear, each glowing with a different energy:

HEART — The Compassionate Leader
BALANCE — The Coaching-Oriented Leader
SPINE — The Command-Driven Leader
scenes.tip: This choice reveals how you lead in the long term.

options.label: A
options.desc: You lead with compassion and emotional insight.

options.label: C
options.desc: You lead with directness and accountability.

growthSuggestions.text: You hold high standards but avoid tough conversations. Practice firmer clarity to strengthen execution.
Your compassion is a strength — but too much softness may dilute performance. Set clearer expectations.
You nurture well but may delay hard decisions. Balance development with firmness.
Step into stronger ownership. Your team mirrors your standards.
Your leadership shows developing balance. Continue refining how you manage conflict, clarity, and team motivation.
